1.name: Modern Times
1.description: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

2.name: Show Boat
2.description: Despite her mother's objections, the naive young daughter of a show boat captain is thrust into the limelight as the company's new leading lady.

3.name: Flash Gordon
3.description: Flash Gordon, Dale Arden and Dr. Alexis Zarkov visit the planet Mongo to thwart the evil schemes of Emperor Ming the Merciless, who has set his planet on a collision course with Earth.

4.name: My Man Godfrey
4.description: A scatterbrained socialite hires a vagrant as a family butler...but there's more to Godfrey than meets the eye.

5.name: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
5.description: A simple, small town man inherits a massive fortune, making him the target for scammers and publicity-seekers. Overwhelmed by the turn his life has taken, and awoken to another use for his new-found fortune, he makes a momentous decision.

6.name: Dracula's Daughter
6.description: Hungarian countess Marya Zaleska seeks the aid of a noted psychiatrist, hoping to free herself of a mysterious evil influence.

7.name: Strike Me Pink
7.description: Meek Eddie Pink becomes manager of an amusement park beset by mobsters.

8.name: Dodsworth
8.description: A retired auto manufacturer and his wife take a long-planned European vacation only to find that they want very different things from life.

9.name: Camille
9.description: A Parisian courtesan must choose between the young man who loves her and the callous baron who wants her, even as her own health begins to fail.

10.name: The Petrified Forest
10.description: A waitress, a hobo and a bank robber get mixed up at a lonely diner in the desert.

11.name: Things to Come
11.description: The story of a century: a decades-long second World War leaves plague and anarchy, then a rational state rebuilds civilization and attempts space travel.

12.name: Tell Your Children
12.description: Cautionary tale features a fictionalized take on the use of marijuana. A trio of drug dealers lead innocent teenagers to become addicted to "reefer" cigarettes by holding wild parties with jazz music.

13.name: Sabotage
13.description: A Scotland Yard undercover detective is on the trail of a saboteur who is part of a plot to set off a bomb in London. But when the detective's cover is blown, the plot begins to unravel.

14.name: The Great Ziegfeld
14.description: The ups and downs of Florenz Ziegfeld Jr., famed producer of extravagant stage revues, are portrayed.

15.name: Fury
15.description: When a wrongly accused prisoner barely survives a lynch mob attack and is presumed dead, he vindictively decides to fake his death and frame the mob for his supposed murder.

16.name: Swing Time
16.description: A performer and gambler travels to New York City to raise the $25,000 he needs to marry his fiancée, only to become entangled with a beautiful aspiring dancer.

17.name: Our Relations
17.description: Two pairs of long-lost twin brothers experience high jinks involving a valuable ring, cases of mistaken identity, and gangsters.

18.name: The Plainsman
18.description: Wild Bill Hickok attempts to stop an Indian uprising that was started by white gun-runners.

19.name: After the Thin Man
19.description: Nick investigates the case of a missing man and later a murder that is connected to Nora's family.

20.name: Mary of Scotland
20.description: The recently widowed Mary Stuart returns to Scotland to reclaim her throne but is opposed by her half-brother and her own Scottish lords.

21.name: Secret Agent
21.description: After three British Agents are assigned to assassinate a mysterious German spy during World War I, two of them become ambivalent when their duty to the mission conflicts with their consciences.

22.name: San Francisco
22.description: A Barbary Coast saloonkeeper and a Nob Hill impresario are rivals for the affections of a beautiful singer, both personally and professionally in 1906 San Francisco.

23.name: Follow the Fleet
23.description: A Navy sailor tries to rekindle a romance with the woman he loves while on liberty in San Francisco.

24.name: Anything Goes
24.description: A young man falls in love with a beautiful blonde. When he sees her being forced onto a luxury liner, he decides to follow and rescue her. However, he discovers that she is an English ...                See full summary »

25.name: Born to Dance
25.description: Sailor Ted meets at the Lonely Hearts Club of his friend Gunny's wife, Jenny, a girl, Nora Paige, and falls in love. Nora wants to become a dancer on Broadway. Ted rescues the Pekinese of ...                See full summary »

26.name: Rembrandt
26.description: This character study joins the painter at the height of his fame in 1642, when his adored wife suddenly dies and his work takes a dark, sardonic turn that offends his patrons. By 1656, he ...                See full summary »

27.name: These Three
27.description: Two school teachers and the man they both love face ruin when a malicious student cooks up a lie.

28.name: The Last of the Mohicans
28.description: As Alice and Cora Munro attempt to find their father, a British officer in the French and Indian War, they are set upon by French soldiers and their cohorts, Huron tribesmen led by the evil...                See full summary »

29.name: The Charge of the Light Brigade
29.description: A major countermands orders and attacks to avenge a previous massacre of men, women, and children.

30.name: Romeo and Juliet
30.description: Young love is poisoned by a generations long feud between two noble families.

31.name: Adventure in Manhattan
31.description: A reporter meets an actress whose producer is a presumed-dead thief, and stakes his reputation on predicting the next crime.

32.name: Libeled Lady
32.description: A newspaper man, his ignored fiancée, and his former employee, a down on his luck reporter, hatch an elaborate scheme to turn a false news story into the truth in order to prevent a high-society woman from suing for libel.

33.name: The Walking Dead
33.description: After hapless pianist and ex-con John Elman is framed for murder, he is resurrected by a scientist after his execution.

34.name: The Bohemian Girl
34.description: A band of Gypsies are camped outside the walls of Count Arnheim's palace. Oliver's wife kidnaps the Count's daughter Arline, then leaves the child and runs off with her lover, Devilshoof. ...                See full summary »

35.name: Love on the Run
35.description: A runaway bride and an undercover reporter get caught up in political intrigue as they lead a merry chase across Europe and uncover a spy plot.

36.name: Tarzan Escapes
36.description: An expedition seeking to bring Jane back to civilization, and Tarzan into captivity, gets more than it's bargained for.

37.name: Captain January
37.description: A little girl named Star lives with a lighthouse keeper who rescued her when her parents drowned. A truant officer decides she should go to boarding school but she's rescued by relatives.

38.name: Hopalong Cassidy Returns
38.description: A crusading newspaper editor recruits his old friend Hoppy to take the job of marshal in a town rife with vice and murder directed at helpless miners.

39.name: Private Number
39.description: A maid secretly marries the son of her wealthy boss.

40.name: Little Lord Fauntleroy
40.description: An American boy turns out to be the long-lost heir of a British fortune. He is sent to live with the cold and unsentimental lord who oversees the trust.

41.name: The Invisible Ray
41.description: A scientist becomes murderous after discovering, and being exposed to the radiation of, a powerful new element called Radium X.

42.name: The Story of Louis Pasteur
42.description: The biography of the pioneering French microbiologist who helped revolutionize agriculture and medicine.

43.name: Come and Get It
43.description: An ambitious lumberjack abandons his saloon girl lover so that he can marry into wealth, but years later becomes infatuated with the woman's daughter.

44.name: Bullets or Ballots
44.description: After Police Captain Dan McLaren becomes police commissioner former detective Johnny Blake knocks him down convincing rackets boss Al Kruger that Blake is sincere in his effort to join the ...                See full summary »

45.name: Theodora Goes Wild
45.description: The author of a controversially racy best-selling book tries to hide her celebrity status from her provincial small-town neighbors, who'd be scandalized if they knew.

46.name: Call of the Prairie
46.description: Hoppy has to bust up a gang of outlaws with the help of his sidekicks Shanghai and Johnny. As usual, he walks through the fusillade unscathed.

47.name: Le crime de Monsieur Lange
47.description: A man and a woman arrive in a cafe-hotel near the Belgian frontier. The customers recognize the man from the police description. His name is Amedee Lange, and he murdered Batala in Paris. ...                See full summary »

48.name: Wife vs. Secretary
48.description: The wife of a publishing executive mistakenly believes that her husband's relationship with his attractive secretary is more than professional.

49.name: Craig's Wife
49.description: A domineering woman marries a wealthy man for his money, and then uses her position to further her own ambitions for money and power.

50.name: Three Smart Girls
50.description: Three sisters scheme to reunite their divorced parents before their wealthy father marries a conniving gold digger.
